items.name: UIManager
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: UIManager
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================

class Formula
    ###*
    * Encapsulates a UI formula. A formula can be used in UI layouts to define
    * property-bindings or to implement a specific behavior.
    *
    * @module ui
    * @class Formula
    * @memberof ui
    * @constructor
    * @param {Function} f - The formula-function. Defines the logic of the formula.
    * @param {Object} data - An optional data-object which can be accessed inside the formula-function.
    * @param {string} event - An optional event-name to define when the formula should be executed.
    ###
    constructor: (f, data, event) ->
        ###*
        * Indicates if its the first time the formula is called.
        * @property onInitialize
        * @type boolean
        ###
        @onInitialize = yes
        
        ###*
        * The formula-function.
        * @property exec_
        * @type Function
        ###
        @exec_ = f
         
        ###*
        * An optional data-object which can bes accessed inside the formula-function.
        * @property data
        * @type Object
        ###   
        @data = data
        
        ###*
        * An optional event-name to define when the formula should be executed.
        * @property event
        * @type string
        ### 
        @event = event
        
        ###*
        * An array of custom number-data which can be used for different purposes. The first element
        * is also used in onChange method to store the old value and check against the new one to detect a change.
        * @property numbers
        * @type number[]
        ### 
        @numbers = new Array(10)
        @numbers[i] = 0 for i in [0..@numbers.length]
        
        ###*
        * An array of custom string-data which can be used for different purposes. The first element
        * is also used in onTextChange method to store the old value and check against the new one to detect a change.
        * @property strings
        * @type string[]
        ###
        @strings = new Array(10)
        @strings[i] = "" for i in [0..@strings.length]
        
    
    ###*
    * The formula-function. Its a wrapper-function before the first-time call was made.
    * @method exec
    ###
    exec: ->
       @exec = @exec_
       r = @exec_.apply(this, arguments)
       @onInitialize = no
       
       return r
       
    ###*
    * Checks if the specified number-value has changed since the last check. It uses
    * the first entry of the numbers-array to store the value and check against the new one.
    *
    * @method onChange
    * @param {number} numberValue - Number value to check.
    ###    
    onChange: (numberValue) ->
        result = @numbers[0] != numberValue
        @numbers[0] = numberValue
        
        return result
     
    ###*
    * Checks if the specified text-value has changed since the last check. It uses
    * the first entry of the strings-array to store the value and check against the new one.
    *
    * @method onTextChange
    * @param {string} textValue - Text value to check.
    ###     
    onTextChange: (textValue) ->
        result = @strings[0] != textValue
        @strings[0] = textValue
        
        return result
        
ui.Formula = Formula

class Space
    ###*
    * Describes a space inside or around something like a margin or padding.
    *
    * @module ui
    * @class Space
    * @memberof ui
    * @constructor
    * @param {number} left - Space at the left in pixels.
    * @param {number} top - Space at the top in pixels.
    * @param {number} right - Space at the right in pixels.
    * @param {number} bottom - Space at the bottom in pixels.
    ###
    constructor: (left, top, right, bottom) ->
        ###*
        * Space at the left in pixels.
        * @property left
        * @type number
        ###
        @left = left
        
        ###*
        * Space at the top in pixels.
        * @property top
        * @type number
        ###
        @top = top
        
        ###*
        * Space at the right in pixels.
        * @property right
        * @type number
        ###
        @right = right
        
        ###*
        * Space at the bottom in pixels.
        * @property bottom
        * @type number
        ###
        @bottom = bottom
      
    ###*
    * Sets the coordinates of the space by copying them from a specified space.
    *
    * @method setFromObject
    * @param {Object} space - A space to copy.
    ###   
    setFromObject: (space) ->
        @left = space.left
        @top = space.top
        @right = space.right
        @bottom = space.bottom
      
    ###*
    * Sets the coordinates of the space.
    *
    * @method set
    * @param {number} left - Space at the left in pixels.
    * @param {number} top - Space at the top in pixels.
    * @param {number} right - Space at the right in pixels.
    * @param {number} bottom - Space at the bottom in pixels.
    ###    
    set: (left, top, right, bottom) ->
        @left = left
        @top = top
        @right = right
        @bottom = bottom
    
    ###*
    * Creates a new space object from an array of coordinates.
    *
    * @method fromArray
    * @static
    * @param {number[]} array - An array of coordinates (left, top right, bottom).
    ###    
    @fromArray: (array) -> new ui.Space(array[0], array[1], array[2], array[3])
        
ui.Space = Space

class Style
    ###*
    * A UI style can applied to a UI object to modify it properties like color, image, etc. to give a certain "style" to it.
    *
    * @module ui
    * @class Style
    * @memberof ui
    * @constructor
    * @param {Object} descriptor - A style-descriptor to initialize the style from.
    * @param {number} id - A unique numeric ID to access the style through UIManager.stylesById collection.
    * @param {number} selector - A selector ID which controls under which conditions the styles will be applied.
    ###
    constructor: (descriptor, id, selector) ->
        ###*
        * ID number to quickly access this style and link to this style.
        * @property id
        * @type number
        ###
        @id = id
        
        ###*
        * Style-ID of target object. This style will only be applied on UI objects with that style ID which are
        * children of UI objects where this style is applied.
        * @property target
        * @type number
        ###
        @target = -1
        
        ###*
        * Selector-ID which controls under which conditions the style becomes active.
        * @property selector
        * @type number
        ###
        @selector = selector
        
        ###*
        * The font used for the text-display.
        * @default null
        * @property font
        * @type gs.Font
        ###
        @font = null
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's image used for visual presentation.
        * @property image
        * @type string
        ###
        @image = null
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's animations used for visual presentation.
        * @default null
        * @property animations
        * @type Object[]
        ###
        @animations = null
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's color.
        * @property color
        * @type gs.Color
        ###
        @color = null
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's tone.
        * @property tone
        * @type gs.Tone
        ###
        @tone = null
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's anchor-point. For example: An anchor-point with 0,0 places the object with its top-left corner
        * at its position but with an 0.5, 0.5 anchor-point the object is placed with its center. An anchor-point of 1,1
        * places the object with its lower-right corner.
        * @property anchor
        * @type gs.Point
        ###
        @anchor = null
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's zoom-setting for x and y axis.
        * @default new gs.Point(1.0, 1.0)
        * @property zoom
        * @type gs.Point
        ###
        @zoom = null
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's margin. The margin defines an extra space around the UI object. 
        * The default is { left: 0, top: 0, right: 0, bottom: 0 }.
        * @property margin
        * @type Object
        ###
        @margin = null
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's padding. The default is { left: 0, top: 0, right: 0, bottom: 0 }.
        * @property padding
        * @type Object
        ###
        @padding = null
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's mask for masking-effects.
        * @property mask
        * @type gs.Mask
        ###
        @mask = null
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's alignment.
        * @property alignment
        * @type ui.Alignment
        ###
        @alignment = -1
        
        ###*
        * The UI object's opacity to control transparency. For example: 0 = Transparent, 255 = Opaque, 128 = Semi-Transparent.
        * @property opacity
        * @type number
        ###
        @opacity = -1
        
        ###*
        * The object's clip-rect for visual presentation.
        * @default null
        * @property clipRect
        * @type gs.Rect
        * @protected
        ###
        @clipRect = null
        
        ###*
        * The corner-size of the frame.
        * @property frameCornerSize
        * @type number
        ###
        @frameCornerSize = -1
        
        ###*
        * The thickness of the frame.
        * @property frameThickness
        * @type number
        ###
        @frameThickness = -1
        
        ###*
        * The looping of the image.
        * @property looping
        * @type ui.Orientation
        ###
        @looping = null
        
        ###*
        * The object's z-index controls rendering-order/image-overlapping. An object with a smaller z-index is rendered
        * before an object with a larger index. For example: To make sure a game object is always on top of the screen, it
        * should have the largest z-index of all game objects.
        * @property zIndex
        * @type number
        ###
        @zIndex = -1
        
        ###*
        * The object's alignment on x-axis. Needs to be supported by layout.
        * @property alignmentX
        * @type number
        ###
        @alignmentX = -1
        
        ###*
        * The object's alignment on y-axis. Needs to be supported by layout.
        * @property alignmentY
        * @type number
        ###
        @alignmentY = -1
        
        ###*
        * The object's resize behavior.
        * @property resizable
        * @type boolean
        ###
        @resizable = null
        
        ###*
        * The original style descriptor.
        * @property descriptor
        * @type Object
        ###
        @descriptor = descriptor
        
        if descriptor
            @setFromDescriptor(descriptor)

    ###*
    * Initializes the style from a style-descriptor.
    *
    * @method setFromDescriptor
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The style-descriptor.
    ### 
    setFromDescriptor: (descriptor) ->
        @descriptor = descriptor
        @image = descriptor.image
        @color = gs.Color.fromArray(descriptor.color) if descriptor.color
        @tone = gs.Tone.fromArray(descriptor.tone) if descriptor.tone
        @anchor = new gs.Point(descriptor.anchor[0], descriptor.anchor[1]) if descriptor.anchor
        @zoom = new gs.Point(descriptor.zoom[0], descriptor.zoom[1]) if descriptor.zoom
        
        if descriptor.font
            @setupFont(descriptor)
            
        if descriptor.clipRect
            @clipRect = gs.Rect.fromArray(descriptor.clipRect)
            
        @opacity = descriptor.opacity if descriptor.opacity >= 0
        @alignment = descriptor.alignment if descriptor.alignment >= 0
        @margin = ui.Space.fromArray(descriptor.margin) if descriptor.margin
        @padding = ui.Space.fromArray(descriptor.padding) if descriptor.padding
        @animations = descriptor.animations
        @frameCornerSize = descriptor.frameCornerSize if descriptor.frameCornerSize
        @frameThickness = descriptor.frameThickness if descriptor.frameThickness
        @frame = descriptor.frame if descriptor.frame
        @looping = descriptor.looping if descriptor.looping
        @resizable = descriptor.resizable if descriptor.resizable?
        @zIndex = descriptor.zIndex if descriptor.zIndex
        @alignmentX = ui.UIManager.alignments[descriptor.alignmentX] if descriptor.alignmentX
        @alignmentY = ui.UIManager.alignments[descriptor.alignmentY] if descriptor.alignmentY
        
    set: (style) ->
        @image = style.image
        @color.setFromObject(style.color)
        @tone.setFromObject(style.tone)
        @anchor.set(style.anchor.x, style.anchor.y)
        @zoom.set(style.zoom.x, style.zoom.y)
        
        if style.font
            if !@font then @font = new gs.Font(style.font.name, style.font.size)
            @font.set(style.font)
            
        if style.clipRect
            if !@clipRect then @clipRect = new gs.Rect()
            @clipRect.setFromObject(style.clipRect)
            
        @opacity = style.opacitz
        @alignment = style.alignment
        @margin.setFromObject(style.margin)
        @padding.setFromObject(style.padding)
        
    ###*
    * Initializes font-data from a style-descriptor.
    *
    * @method setupFont
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The style-descriptor.
    * @protected
    ### 
    setupFont: (descriptor) ->
        if descriptor.font
            if !@font
                @font = new Font(descriptor.font.name, descriptor.font.size ? 0)
            else
                @font.name = descriptor.font.name
                @font.size = descriptor.font.size ? 0
                
            @font.bold = descriptor.font.bold ? @font.bold
            @font.italic = descriptor.font.italic ? @font.italic
            @font.smallCaps = descriptor.font.smallCaps ? @font.smallCaps
            @font.underline = descriptor.font.underline ? @font.underline
            @font.strikeThrough = descriptor.font.strikeThrough ? @font.strikeThrough
            
            if descriptor.font.color?
                @font.color.setFromArray(descriptor.font.color)
            
            if descriptor.font.border?
                @font.border = descriptor.font.border ? no
                @font.borderSize = descriptor.font.borderSize ? 4
                @font.borderColor.set(0, 0, 0, 255)
                
            if descriptor.font.outline?
                @font.border = descriptor.font.outline ? no
                @font.borderSize = descriptor.font.outline.size ? 4
                
                if descriptor.font.outline.color?
                    @font.borderColor.setFromArray(descriptor.font.outline.color)
                else
                    @font.borderColor.set(0, 0, 0, 255)
    
    ###*
    * Applies the style to a UI object.
    *
    * @method apply
    * @param {ui.Object_UIElement} object - The UI object where the style should be applied to.
    ###                
    apply: (object) ->
        if not object.activeStyles.contains(this)
            object.activeStyles.push(this)
            if @font then object.font?.set(@font)
            if @color then object.color.set(@color)
            if @tone then object.tone?.set(@tone)
            if @image then object.image = @image
            if @anchor then object.anchor.set(@anchor.x, @anchor.y)
            if @zoom then object.zoom.set(@zoom.x, @zoom.y)
            if @padding then object.padding.setFromObject(@padding)
            if @margin then object.margin.setFromObject(@margin)
            if @opacity >= 0 then object.opacity = @opacity
            if @alignment >= 0 then object.alignment = @alignment
            if @frameThickness >= 0 then object.frameThickness = @frameThickness
            if @frameCornerSize >= 0 then object.frameCornerSize = @frameCornerSize
            if @mask then object.mask.set(@mask)
            if @zIndex >= 0 then object.zIndex = @zIndex
            if @alignmentX >= 0 then object.alignmentX = @alignmentX
            if @alignmentY >= 0 then object.alignmentY = @alignmentY
            if @resizable? then object.resizable = @resizable
            
            @applyLooping(object)
            @applyAnimations(object)
     
    ###*
    * Applies the looping-data of the style to a UI object.
    *
    * @method applyLooping
    * @param {ui.Object_UIElement} object - The UI object where the looping-data should be applied to.
    * @protected
    ###     
    applyLooping: (object) ->
        if @looping
            if !object.visual.looping
                object.visual.dispose()
                object.removeComponent(object.visual)
                object.visual = new gs.Component_TilingSprite()
                object.addComponent(object.visual)
            
            object.visual.looping.vertical = @looping.vertical
            object.visual.looping.horizontal = @looping.horizontal
     
    ###*
    * Applies the animation-data of the style to a UI object. This automatically adds an animation-handler
    * component(ui.Component_AnimationHandler) with the id "animationHandler" to the UI object if not already exists.
    *
    * @method applyAnimations
    * @param {ui.Object_UIElement} object - The UI object where the animation-data should be applied to.
    * @protected
    ###        
    applyAnimations: (object) ->
        if @animations
            object.animations = Object.deepCopy(@animations)
            if !object.findComponentById("animationHandler")
                object.animationExecutor = new ui.Component_AnimationExecutor()
                object.addComponent(new ui.Component_AnimationHandler(), "animationHandler")
                object.addComponent(object.animationExecutor, "animationExecutor")
                
      
    ###*
    * Reverts the changes from a UI object made by this style. However, this resets all styleable properties
    * were set by this style. So it is necessary to apply all other styles again, but that is already handles in
    * ui.Component_UIBehavior.
    *
    * @method revert
    * @param {ui.Object_UIElement} object - The UI object where the style should be reverted.
    ###             
    revert: (object) ->
        activeStyles = object.activeStyles
        if object.activeStyles.contains(this)
            object.activeStyles.remove(this)
            
            if @font then object.font.set(gs.Fonts.TEXT);               (if s.font then object.font.set(s.font); break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @color then object.color.set(Color.WHITE);               (if s.color then object.color.set(s.color); break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @tone then object.tone?.set(0, 0, 0, 0);                 (if s.tone then object.tone?.set(s.tone); break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @image then object.image = null;                         (if s.image then object.image = s.image; break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @anchor then object.anchor.set(0, 0);                    (if s.anchor then object.anchor.setFromObject(s.anchor); break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @zoom then object.zoom.set(1.0, 1.0);                    (if s.zoom then object.zoom.setFromObject(s.zoom); break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @padding then object.padding.set(0, 0, 0, 0);            (if s.padding then object.padding.setFromObject(s.padding); break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @margin then object.margin.set(0, 0, 0, 0);              (if s.margin then object.margin.setFromObject(s.margin); break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @opacity >= 0 then object.opacity = 255;                 (if s.opacity >= 0 then object.opacity = s.opacity; break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @alignment >= 0 then object.alignment = 0;               (if s.alignment >= 0 then object.alignment = s.alignment; break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @frameCornerSize >= 0 then object.frameCornerSize = 16;  (if s.frameCornerSize >= 0 then object.frameCornerSize = s.frameCornerSize; break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @frameThickness >= 0 then object.frameThickness = 16;    (if s.frameThickness >= 0 then object.frameThickness = s.frameThickness; break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @mask then object.mask.set(null);                        (if s.mask then object.mask.set(s.font); break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @zIndex >= 0 then object.zIndex = 0;                     (if s.zIndex >= 0 then object.zIndex = s.zIndex; break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @alignmentX >= 0 then object.alignmentX = 0;             (if s.alignmentX >= 0 then object.alignmentX = s.alignmentX; break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @alignmentY >= 0 then object.alignmentY = 0;             (if s.alignmentY >= 0 then object.alignmentY = s.alignmentY; break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            if @resizable? then object.resizable = no;                  (if s.resizable? then object.resizable = s.resizable; break) for s in activeStyles by -1
            
            @revertAnimations(object)
            @revertLooping(object)
                    
    ###*
    * Reverts the animation-data changes applied to a UI object by this style.
    *
    * @method revertAnimations
    * @param {ui.Object_UIElement} object - The UI object where the animation-data changes should be reverted.
    ###                 
    revertAnimations: (object) ->
        activeStyles = object.activeStyles
        if @animations
            object.animations = null;               
            for s in activeStyles by -1
                if s.animations
                    object.animations = Object.deepCopy(s.animations)
                    if !object.findComponentById("animationHandler")
                        object.addComponent(new ui.Component_AnimationHandler(), "animationHandler")
        
    ###*
    * Reverts the looping-data changes applied to a UI object by this style.
    *
    * @method revertLooping
    * @param {ui.Object_UIElement} object - The UI object where the looping-data changes should be reverted.
    ###                 
    revertLooping: (object) ->
        activeStyles = object.activeStyles
        if @looping
            object.visual.looping.vertical = no
            object.visual.looping.horizontal = no
            for s in activeStyles by -1
                if s.looping
                    if !object.visual.looping
                        object.visual.dispose()
                        object.removeComponent(object.visual)
                        object.visual = new gs.Component_TilingSprite()
                        object.addComponent(object.visual)
                    
                    object.visual.looping.vertical = s.looping.vertical
                    object.visual.looping.horizontal = s.looping.horizontal
            
ui.Style = Style

class UIManager
    ###*
    * Handles the creation of In Game UI elements. For more information about
    * In-Game UI see help file.
    *
    * @module ui
    * @class UIManager
    * @memberof ui
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: ->
        ###*
        * Stores all registered UI layouts by name/id.
        * @property layouts
        * @type Object
        ###
        @layouts = {}
        
        ###*
        * Stores all registered UI styles by name/id.
        * @property styles
        * @type Object
        ###
        @styles = {}
        
        ###*
        * Stores all UI styles by number id.
        * @property stylesById
        * @type ui.Style[]
        ###
        @stylesById = new Array()
        
        ###*
        * Stores all UI styles by style-name.
        * @property stylesByName
        * @type Object
        ###
        @stylesByName = {}
        
        ###*
        * Stores all registered custom UI types/templates by name/id.
        * @property customTypes
        * @type Object
        ###
        @customTypes = {}
        
        ###*
        * Stores all registered UI controllers by name/id.
        * @property customTypes
        * @type Object
        ###
        @controllers = {}
        
        ###*
        * Stores all registered UI data sources by name/id.
        * @property customTypes
        * @type Object
        ###
        @dataSources = {}
        
        ###*
        * Mapping to table to map alignment names to number values.
        * @property alignments
        * @type Object
        * @protected
        ###
        @alignments = { "left": 0, "top": 0, "center": 1, "bottom": 2, "right": 2, "0": 0, "1": 1, "2": 2 }
        
        ###*
        * Mapping to table to map blend-mode names to number values.
        * @property blendModes
        * @type Object
        * @protected
        ###
        @blendModes = { "normal": 0, "add": 1, "sub": 2 }
        
        ###*
        * Mapping to table to map selector names to number values.
        * @property selectors
        * @type Object
        ###
        @selectors = { normal: 0, hover: 1, selected: 2, enabled: 3, focused: 4 }
        @defaultPlaceholderParams = {}
    
    ###*
    * Sets up UI Manager, optimizes styles, etc.
    *
    * @method setup
    ###
    setup: ->
        @setupStyles()
        
    ###*
    * Sets up the UI styles by wrapping them into ui.Style objects and optimizing the access.
    *
    * @method setupStyles
    * @protected
    ###
    setupStyles: ->
        id = 0
        selectorMap = @selectors
        for k of @styles
            subs = k.split(" ")
            selector = subs[0].split(":")
            
            if selectorMap[selector[1]]
                @stylesById[id] = new ui.Style(@styles[k], id, selectorMap[selector[1]])
            else
                @stylesById[id] = new ui.Style(@styles[k], id, 0)
            
            if !@stylesByName[selector[0]]
                @stylesByName[selector[0]] = []
                
            @stylesByName[selector[0]].push(@stylesById[id])
            @styles[k] = @stylesById[id]
            
            id++
        
        for k of @styles
            subs = k.split(" ")
            if subs.length > 1
                @stylesByName[subs[1]].push(@styles[k])
                @styles[k].target = @styles[k.split(":")[0]]?.id
                #@styles[subs[1]].target = @styles[k].id
                #@styles[k].target = @styles[subs[1]].id
            
        return null
        
    ###*
    * Executes all placeholder formulas in the specified descriptor. The descriptor will be changed
    * and placeholder formulas are replaced with their evaluated result value.
    *
    * @method executePlaceholderFormulas
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The descriptor.
    * @param {Object} params - Object containing the placeholder params.
    * @protected
    ###    
    executePlaceholderFormulas: (descriptor, id, params) ->
        return if not descriptor?
        keys = Object.keys(descriptor)
            
        for k in keys
            v = descriptor[k]
            if v?
                if v instanceof Array
                    for i, c in v
                        if i?
                            if typeof i == "object"
                                @executePlaceholderFormulas(i, id, params)
                            else if c != "exec" and typeof i == "function"
                                window.p = params ||  @defaultPlaceholderParams
                                window.d = descriptor
                                v[c] = i()
                else if typeof v == "object"
                    @executePlaceholderFormulas(v, id, params)
                else if k != "exec_" and typeof v == "function"
                    window.p = params || @defaultPlaceholderParams
                    window.d = descriptor
                    descriptor[k] = v()
        return null

    ###*
    * Creates a calculation for a specified expression.
    *
    * @method createCalcFunction
    * @param {String} expression - The expression to create a calculation function for.
    * @return {Function} The calculation function.
    * @protected
    ###               
    createCalcFunction: (expression) ->
        expression = expression.replace(/([0-9]+)%/gm, "($1 / 100 * v)")
        return eval("(function(v){ return " + expression + "})")
    
    ###*
    * Creates an object from the specified object type. The type has the format
    * <namespace>.<typename> like vn.Component_Hotspot.
    *
    * @method createObject
    * @param {String} type - The type name.
    * @return {Object} The created object.
    * @protected
    ###             
    createObject: (type) ->
        subs = type.split(".")
        return new window[subs[0]][subs[1]]()
      
    ###*
    * Creates an UI object from a specified UI descriptor.
    *
    * @method createFromDescriptor
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @param {gs.Object_UIElement} parent - The UI parent object. (A layout for example).
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created UI object.
    ###   
    createFromDescriptor: (descriptor, parent) ->
        control = null
        
        for k of @controllers
            if @controllers[k].type?
                @controllers[k] = @createObject(@controllers[k].type)
            
        @_createFromDescriptor(descriptor, parent)
    
    
    ###*
    * Creates an image button UI object.
    *
    * @method createImageButton
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###  
    createImageButton: (descriptor) ->
        control = new ui.Object_Hotspot(descriptor.image, descriptor.imageHandling) 
                
        control.behavior.sound = descriptor.sound
        control.behavior.sounds = descriptor.sounds
        control.image = descriptor.image
        control.images = descriptor.images
        if descriptor.imageFolder?
            control.imageFolder = descriptor.imageFolder
            
        if descriptor.looping?
            control.visual.dispose()
            control.removeComponent(control.visual)
            control.visual = new gs.Component_TilingSprite()
            control.addComponent(control.visual)
            
            control.visual.looping.vertical = descriptor.looping.vertical
            control.visual.looping.horizontal = descriptor.looping.horizontal
        if descriptor.color?
            control.color = Color.fromArray(descriptor.color)
    
        return control
    
    ###*
    * Creates an image UI object.
    *
    * @method createImage
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###     
    createImage: (descriptor) ->
        control = new ui.Object_Image(descriptor.image, descriptor.imageHandling) 
                
        if descriptor.imageFolder?
            control.imageFolder = descriptor.imageFolder
            
        if descriptor.looping?
            control.visual.dispose()
            control.removeComponent(control.visual)
            control.visual = new gs.Component_TilingSprite()
            control.addComponent(control.visual)
            
            control.visual.looping.vertical = descriptor.looping.vertical
            control.visual.looping.horizontal = descriptor.looping.horizontal
        if descriptor.color?
            control.color = Color.fromArray(descriptor.color)
                    
        return control
    
    ###*
    * Creates an image map UI object.
    *
    * @method createImageMap
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###        
    createImageMap: (descriptor) ->
        control = new ui.Object_ImageMap()
        control.hotspots = (descriptor.hotspots||[]).select (h) -> 
            { x: h.rect[0], y: h.rect[1], size: { width: h.rect[2], height: h.rect[3] }, data: { action: 3, actions: h.actions } }
        control.images = descriptor.images
        control.insertComponent(new ui.Component_ActionHandler(), 1, "actionHandler")
        control.target = SceneManager.scene.behavior
        control.visual.variableContext = new gs.InterpreterContext(SceneManager.scene.layoutName, SceneManager.scene)
        
        return control
    
    ###*
    * Creates a video UI object.
    *
    * @method createVideo
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###    
    createVideo: (descriptor) ->
        control = new ui.Object_Video()
        control.video = descriptor.video
        control.loop = descriptor.loop ? yes
        
        return control
    
    
    ###*
    * Creates a panel UI object.
    *
    * @method createPanel
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###       
    createPanel: (descriptor) ->
        control = new ui.Object_Panel()
        control.modal = descriptor.modal ? no
        if descriptor.color?
            control.color = Color.fromArray(descriptor.color)
            
        return control
    
    ###*
    * Creates a frame UI object.
    *
    * @method createFrame
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###           
    createFrame: (descriptor) ->
        control = new ui.Object_Frame(descriptor.frameSkin)
        control.frameThickness = descriptor.frameThickness || 16
        control.frameCornerSize = descriptor.frameCornerSize || 16
        control.image = descriptor.image
        control.images = descriptor.images
        
        return control
    
    ###*
    * Creates a three-part image UI object.
    *
    * @method createThreePartImage
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###     
    createThreePartImage: (descriptor) ->
        control = new ui.Object_ThreePartImage(descriptor.frameSkin)
        control.firstPartSize = descriptor.firstPartSize || 16
        control.middlePartSize = descriptor.middlePartSize || 1
        control.lastPartSize = descriptor.lastPartSize || 16
        control.image = descriptor.image
        control.images = descriptor.images
        
        return control
     
    ###*
    * Creates a text UI object.
    *
    * @method createText
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###     
    createText: (descriptor) ->
        control = new ui.Object_Text()
        control.text = lcs(descriptor.text)
        control.sizeToFit = descriptor.sizeToFit
        control.formatting = descriptor.formatting
        control.wordWrap = descriptor.wordWrap ? no
        control.behavior.format = descriptor.format
        if descriptor.textPadding
            control.behavior.padding = ui.Space.fromArray(descriptor.textPadding)
        if descriptor.resolvePlaceholders?
            control.resolvePlaceholders = descriptor.resolvePlaceholders
        if descriptor.color?
            control.color = Color.fromArray(descriptor.color)
            
        return control
    
    ###*
    * Creates a free-layout UI object.
    *
    * @method createFreeLayout
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ### 
    createFreeLayout: (descriptor) ->
        if descriptor.frame?
            control = new ui.Object_FreeLayout(descriptor.frame[0] || 0, descriptor.frame[1] || 0, descriptor.frame[2] || 1, descriptor.frame[3] || 1)
        else
            control = new ui.Object_FreeLayout(0, 0, 1, 1)
        control.sizeToFit = descriptor.sizeToFit
        
        return control
    
    ###*
    * Creates a stack-layout UI object.
    *
    * @method createStackLayout
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###     
    createStackLayout: (descriptor) ->
        if descriptor.frame?
            control = new ui.Object_StackLayout(descriptor.frame[0] || 0, descriptor.frame[1] || 0, descriptor.frame[2] || 1, descriptor.frame[3] || 1, descriptor.orientation)
        else
            control = new ui.Object_StackLayout(0, 0, 1, 1, descriptor.orientation)
        control.sizeToFit = descriptor.sizeToFit
        
        return control
    
    ###*
    * Creates a spread-layout UI object.
    *
    * @method createSpreadLayout
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###     
    createSpreadLayout: (descriptor) ->
        if descriptor.frame?
            control = new ui.Object_SpreadLayout(descriptor.frame[0] || 0, descriptor.frame[1] || 0, descriptor.frame[2] || 1, descriptor.frame[3] || 1, descriptor.orientation)
        else
            control = new ui.Object_SpreadLayout(0, 0, 1, 1, descriptor.orientation)
            
        return control
     
    ###*
    * Creates a grid-layout UI object.
    *
    * @method createGridLayout
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###    
    createGridLayout: (descriptor) ->
        if descriptor.frame?
            control = new ui.Object_GridLayout(descriptor.frame[0], descriptor.frame[1], descriptor.frame[2], descriptor.frame[3], descriptor.rows, descriptor.columns, descriptor.template)
        else
            control = new ui.Object_GridLayout(0, 0, 1, 1, descriptor.rows, descriptor.columns, descriptor.template)
        control.cellSpacing = descriptor.cellSpacing || [0, 0, 0, 0]
        control.sizeToFit = descriptor.sizeToFit
        
        return control
     
    ###*
    * Creates a message UI object.
    *
    * @method createMessage
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###     
    createMessage: (descriptor) ->
        control = new ui.Object_Message() 
        
        return control
     
    ###*
    * Creates a data-grid UI object.
    *
    * @method createDataGrid
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created image button UI object.
    ###    
    createDataGrid: (descriptor) ->
        control = new ui.Object_DataGrid(descriptor)
        
        return control
        
    ###*
    * Creates an UI object depending on the object-type of the specified UI descriptor.
    *
    * @method createControl
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created UI object.
    * @protected
    ###  
    createControl: (descriptor) ->
        control = null
        
        switch descriptor.type
            when "ui.ImageButton"
                control = @createImageButton(descriptor)
            when "ui.Image"
                control = @createImage(descriptor)
            when "ui.ImageMap"
                control = @createImageMap(descriptor)
            when "ui.Video"
                control = @createVideo(descriptor)
            when "ui.Panel"
                control = @createPanel(descriptor)
            when "ui.Frame"
                control = @createFrame(descriptor)
            when "ui.ThreePartImage"
                control = @createThreePartImage(descriptor)
            when "ui.Text"
                control = @createText(descriptor)
            when "ui.Message"
                control = @createMessage(descriptor)
            when "ui.DataGrid"
                control = @createDataGrid(descriptor)
            when "ui.FreeLayout"
                control = @createFreeLayout(descriptor)
            when "ui.StackLayout"
                control = @createStackLayout(descriptor)
            when "ui.SpreadLayout"
                control = @createSpreadLayout(descriptor)
            when "ui.GridLayout"
                control = @createGridLayout(descriptor)
                
        return control
    
    
    createLayoutRect: (frame, control) ->
        if !control.layoutRect
            control.layoutRect = new ui.LayoutRect()
        control.layoutRect.set(0, 0, 0, 0)
        
        if frame?
            if frame[0]?.length?
                control.layoutRect.x = @createCalcFunction(frame[0])
                control.dstRect.x = 0
            else
                control.dstRect.x = (descriptor.frame[0] ? control.dstRect.x)
                
            if frame[1]?.length?
                control.layoutRect.y = @createCalcFunction(frame[1])
                control.dstRect.y = 0
            else
                control.dstRect.y = (frame[1] ? control.dstRect.y)
                
            if frame[2]?.length?
                control.layoutRect.width = @createCalcFunction(frame[2])
                control.dstRect.width = 1
            else
                control.dstRect.width = (frame[2] ? control.dstRect.width)
                
            if frame[3]?.length?
                control.layoutRect.height = @createCalcFunction(frame[3])
                control.dstRect.height = 1
            else
                control.dstRect.height = (frame[3] ? control.dstRect.height)
     
    
    ###*
    * Adds the styles defined in an array of style-names to the specified control.
    *
    * @method addControlStyles
    * @param {Object} control - The control to add the styles to.
    * @param {string[]} styles - Array of style-names to add.
    ###     
    addControlStyles: (control, styles) ->
        for styleName in styles
            if @stylesByName[styleName]?
                for style in @stylesByName[styleName]
                    control.styles.push(style)
                    if style.target == -1 and style.selector == 0
                        style.apply(control)
    ###*
    * Creates an UI object from a specified UI descriptor. This method is called
    * recursively for all child-descriptors.
    *
    * @method createControlFromDescriptor
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @param {gs.Object_UIElement} parent - The UI parent object. (A layout for example).
    * @param {number} index - The index.
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created UI object.
    * @protected
    ###        
    createControlFromDescriptor: (descriptor, parent, index) ->
        control = null
        
        if descriptor.style?
            descriptor.styles = [descriptor.style]
            delete descriptor.style
            
        descriptor = Object.deepCopy(descriptor)
        @executePlaceholderFormulas(descriptor, descriptor.id, descriptor.params)
            
        control = @createControl(descriptor)
        
        if not control?
            type = Object.deepCopy(@customTypes[descriptor.type])
            
            @executePlaceholderFormulas(type, descriptor.id, descriptor.params)
       
            typeName = type.type
            customFields = type.customFields
            bindings = type.bindings
            formulas = type.formulas
            actions = type.actions
            if type.style?
                type.styles = [type.style]
                type.style = null
                
            Object.mixin(type, descriptor)
            if customFields? then Object.mixin(type.customFields, customFields)
            if bindings? and bindings != type.bindings then type.bindings = type.bindings.concat(bindings)
            if formulas? and formulas != type.formulas then type.formulas = type.formulas.concat(formulas)
            if actions? and actions != type.actions then type.actions = actions.concat(type.actions)
            type.type = typeName
            
            return @createControlFromDescriptor(type, parent)
        else if parent?
            parent.addObject(control)
            control.index = index
        else
            gs.ObjectManager.current.addObject(control)
         
        control.ui = new ui.Component_UIBehavior()
        control.addComponent(control.ui)
        
                
                    
        control.params = descriptor.params
        
        if descriptor.updateBehavior == "continuous"
            control.updateBehavior = ui.UpdateBehavior.CONTINUOUS
            
        if descriptor.inheritProperties
            control.inheritProperties = yes
            
        if descriptor.font?
            control.font = new Font(descriptor.font.name, descriptor.font.size)
            control.font.bold = descriptor.font.bold ? control.font.bold
            control.font.italic = descriptor.font.italic ? control.font.italic
            control.font.smallCaps = descriptor.font.smallCaps ? control.font.smallCaps
            control.font.underline = descriptor.font.underline ? control.font.underline
            control.font.strikeThrough = descriptor.font.strikeThrough ? control.font.strikeThrough
            
            if descriptor.font.color?
                control.font.color = Color.fromArray(descriptor.font.color)
            if descriptor.font.border?
                control.font.border = descriptor.font.border ? no
                control.font.borderSize = descriptor.font.borderSize ? 4
              #if descriptor.font.border.color
            #        control.font.borderColor = Color.fromArray(descriptor.font.border.color)
                control.font.borderColor = new Color(0, 0, 0)
                
            if descriptor.font.outline?
                control.font.border = descriptor.font.outline ? no
                control.font.borderSize = descriptor.font.outline.size ? 4
                
                if descriptor.font.outline.color?
                    control.font.borderColor = Color.fromArray(descriptor.font.outline.color)
                else
                    control.font.borderColor = new Color(0, 0, 0)
                        
        if descriptor.components?
            for c in descriptor.components
                m = c.module || "gs"
                component = new window[m][c.type](c.params)
                control.addComponent(component, c.id)
                control[c.id] = component
                #component.setup?()
         
        control.focusable = descriptor.focusable ? control.focusable       
        if descriptor.nextKeyObject
            control.ui.nextKeyObjectId = descriptor.nextKeyObject
        
        if descriptor.initialFocus
            control.ui.focus()
            
        actions = Object.deepCopy(if descriptor.action? then [descriptor.action] else descriptor.actions) 
        if actions?
            for action in actions
                if action?
                    action.event = action.event ? "onAccept"
                    if not action.target?
                        target = if @controllers? then @controllers[descriptor.target] else controller
                        action.target = target || SceneManager.scene.behavior
            
            control.actions = actions
            
            if(!control.findComponentById("actionHandler"))
                control.insertComponent(new ui.Component_ActionHandler(), 1, "actionHandler")
        
        if descriptor.id?
            control.id = descriptor.id
            gs.ObjectManager.current.setObjectById(control, control.id)
            
        control.descriptor = descriptor
        control.layoutRect = new Rect()
        control.layoutRect.set(0, 0, 0, 0)
        if descriptor.frame?
            if descriptor.frame[0]?.length?
                control.layoutRect.x = @createCalcFunction(descriptor.frame[0])
                control.dstRect.x = 0
            else
                control.dstRect.x = (descriptor.frame[0] ? control.dstRect.x)
                
            if descriptor.frame[1]?.length?
                control.layoutRect.y = @createCalcFunction(descriptor.frame[1])
                control.dstRect.y = 0
            else
                control.dstRect.y = (descriptor.frame[1] ? control.dstRect.y)
                
            if descriptor.frame[2]?.length?
                control.layoutRect.width = @createCalcFunction(descriptor.frame[2])
                control.dstRect.width = 1
            else
                control.dstRect.width = (descriptor.frame[2] ? control.dstRect.width)
                
            if descriptor.frame[3]?.length?
                control.layoutRect.height = @createCalcFunction(descriptor.frame[3]) #parseInt(descriptor.frame[3].split("%")[0])
                control.dstRect.height = 1
            else
                control.dstRect.height = (descriptor.frame[3] ? control.dstRect.height)
           
        if descriptor.sizeToParent?
            control.sizeToParent = descriptor.sizeToParent
            
        if descriptor.blendMode?
            control.blendMode = @blendModes[descriptor.blendMode]
            
        if descriptor.anchor?
            control.anchor.set(descriptor.anchor[0], descriptor.anchor[1])
        

        control.opacity = descriptor.opacity ? 255    
        if descriptor.minimumSize?
            control.minimumSize = { width: descriptor.minimumSize[0], height: descriptor.minimumSize[1] }
            
        if descriptor.resizable? then control.resizable = descriptor.resizable
        if descriptor.scrollable? then control.scrollable = descriptor.scrollable 
        if descriptor.fixedSize? then control.fixedSize = descriptor.fixedSize
        if descriptor.draggable?
            control.draggable = descriptor.draggable
            control.draggable.step = 0
            if control.draggable.rect?
                control.draggable.rect = Rect.fromArray(control.draggable.rect)
            control.addComponent(new ui.Component_Draggable())
        
        if descriptor.bindings?
            control.bindings = descriptor.bindings
            control.insertComponent(new ui.Component_BindingHandler(), 0)
            
        if descriptor.formulas?
            control.formulas = descriptor.formulas
            control.insertComponent(new ui.Component_FormulaHandler(), 0)
            
        control.dataField = descriptor.dataField
        control.enabled = descriptor.enabled ? yes
        if descriptor.selectable? then control.selectable = descriptor.selectable
        if descriptor.group? 
            control.group = descriptor.group
            gs.ObjectManager.current.addToGroup(control, control.group)
        
        if descriptor.customFields?
            control.customFields = Object.deepCopy(descriptor.customFields)
            
        if descriptor.margin?
            control.margin.left = descriptor.margin[0]
            control.margin.top = descriptor.margin[1]
            control.margin.right = descriptor.margin[2]
            control.margin.bottom = descriptor.margin[3]
            
        if descriptor.padding?
            control.padding.left = descriptor.padding[0]
            control.padding.top = descriptor.padding[1]
            control.padding.right = descriptor.padding[2]
            control.padding.bottom = descriptor.padding[3]
            
        if descriptor.alignment?
            control.alignment = @alignments[descriptor.alignment]
            
        control.alignmentY = @alignments[descriptor.alignmentY || 0]
        control.alignmentX = @alignments[descriptor.alignmentX || 0]
        control.zIndex = descriptor.zIndex || 0
        control.order = descriptor.order || 0
        control.chainOrder = (descriptor.chainOrder ? descriptor.zOrder) + (parent?.chainOrder || 0)
        if descriptor.zoom?
            control.zoom = x: descriptor.zoom[0] / 100, y: descriptor.zoom[1] / 100
        #control.dataFields = dataFields
        #control.controllers = @controllers
        #control.controller = controller
        
        if descriptor.visible?
            control.visible = descriptor.visible
        if descriptor.clipRect
            control.clipRect = new Rect(control.dstRect.x, control.dstRect.y, control.dstRect.width, control.dstRect.height)

        if descriptor.styles?
            @addControlStyles(control, descriptor.styles)
            
                    
        if descriptor.template?
            control.behavior.managementMode = ui.LayoutManagementMode.fromString(descriptor.managementMode)
            data = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(control, control.dataField) #control.dataFields[control.dataField]
            isNumber = typeof data == "number"
            if data?
                for i in [0...(data.length ? data)]
                    if data[i]? or isNumber
                        valid = yes
                        if descriptor.dataFilter? and not isNumber
                            valid = ui.Component_Handler.checkCondition(data[i], descriptor.dataFilter)
                        if valid or isNumber
                            child = @createControlFromDescriptor(descriptor.template, control, i)
                            #child.dataFields = control.dataFields
                            
                            if data[i]?.dstRect
                                child.dstRect = ui.UIElementRectangle.fromRect(child, data[i].dstRect)
                            if (not child.clipRect?) and control.clipRect?
                                child.clipRect = control.clipRect
                            #child.parent = control
                            control.addObject(child)
                            child.index = i
                            child.order = (data.length ? data) - i
                            control.controls.push(child)
                            
        
        if descriptor.controls and descriptor.controls.exec
            controls = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(descriptor, descriptor.controls)
        else
            controls = descriptor.controls
            
        if controls?
            for item, i in controls
                childControl = @_createFromDescriptor(item, control, i)
                if (not childControl.clipRect?) and control.clipRect?
                    childControl.clipRect = control.clipRect
                childControl.index = i
                childControl.origin.x = control.origin.x + control.dstRect.x
                childControl.origin.y = control.origin.y + control.dstRect.y
                #childControl.parent = control
                control.addObject(childControl)
                control.controls.push(childControl)
                
        if control.styles and control.parentsByStyle
            #for style in control.styles
            
            parent = control.parent
            while parent
                if parent.styles
                    for style in parent.styles
                        if !control.parentsByStyle[style.id]
                            control.parentsByStyle[style.id] = []
                        control.parentsByStyle[style.id].push(parent)
                
                #while parent
                    #if parent.controlsByStyle
                    #    if(!parent.controlsByStyle[style.id])
                    #        parent.controlsByStyle[style.id] = []
                    #    parent.controlsByStyle[style.id].push(control)
                  #  if control.parentsByStyle
                  #      if !control.parentsByStyle[style.id]
                  #          control.parentsByStyle[style.id] = []
                  #      control.parentsByStyle[style.id].push(parent)
                parent = parent.parent
                        
        if descriptor.animations?
            control.animations = Object.deepCopy(descriptor.animations)
            control.animationExecutor = new ui.Component_AnimationExecutor()
            control.addComponent(control.animationExecutor)
            control.addComponent(new ui.Component_AnimationHandler())
         
        control.ui.updateStyle()
        control.setup()
        
        return control
        
    ###*
    * Creates an UI object from a specified UI descriptor.
    *
    * @method _createFromDescriptor
    * @param {Object} descriptor - The UI object descriptor.
    * @param {gs.Object_UIElement} parent - The UI parent object. (A layout for example).
    * @return {gs.Object_UIElement} The created UI object.
    * @protected 
    ###   
    _createFromDescriptor: (descriptor, parent, index) ->     
        control = @createControlFromDescriptor(descriptor, parent, index)
        
        if descriptor.controller?
            controller = @controllers[descriptor.controller]
            control.controller = controller
            control.addComponent(controller)
                
        return control
        
    createLayoutFromDescriptor: (descriptor, parent, index) ->
        @_createFromDescriptor(descriptor, parent, index)
        
                
        
Graphics.width = $PARAMS.resolution.width
Graphics.height = $PARAMS.resolution.height
ui.UiFactory = new UIManager()
ui.UIManager = ui.UiFactory
